result.execSummary:
The defendant Austin M. Hallock was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:30 p.m. Defendant Austin M. Hallock in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf80, 15tr789, 150441, 15tr2248, 15tr2247, 15tr923 and 15tr922. Voorhees statement that non-appearance is due to miscommuncation from PD's office to defendant. Court quashes warrant. Plea questionaire filed. In 15cf80, State moves to amend to a Misdemeanor violation of 34.04(2t) - Granted. State moves to dismiss 15tr789, 15fo441, 15tr922-Granted. Defendant enters no contest plea in 15cf80 as amended and in 15tr923. Michlig/Voorhees/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence

In 15tr2247 and 15tr2248 - fines need to be paid on or before March 28, 2016 at 10:00 a.m. Court quashes warrant. 
Adj. 1:56 p.m.

9:33 a.m. Attorney John E Voorhees in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15fo441, 15tr789, 15cf80, 15tr922, 15tr923.  Voorhees states he has inquired of local jails and defendant is not in jail. Court authorizes warrant. Adj. 9:34 a.m.

9:45 a.m. Attorney John E Voorhees in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf80, 15fo441, 15tr789, 15tr923, 15tr922, Voorhees states defendant is in jail in Marathon County - release date is November 27, 2015 - plea agreement does exist - Michlig statement to resolution/transport - requests date after release date. Off record for scheduling 9:48 a.m. 
9:50 a.m. Bail continued. 
Adj. 9:51 a.m.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

4:15 p.m. Defendant Austin M. Hallock in court, in custody, with attorney John E Voorhees.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Voorhees states there is no agreement since Probation has put a probation apprehensive request on defendant - possibility of revocation - Voorhees requests adjournment - Michlig moves to modify bail to cash bail - Voorhees statement to bail - Court quashes warrant and reinstates signature bond.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 09:15 am.
Notified Sara at ONSO--per Court Commissioner Galen Bayne-Allison, warrant quashed.
requesting plea hearing
Plea/sentencing hearing at 10-15-2015 04:00 pm

*** Reporter appears telephonically*****  Case called 11:33 a.m.:  Attorney John E Voorhees in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Off record - Atty Voorhees statement to court - defendant not present and no explanation for his nonappearance today.  On record -  Also calling 15TR789 and 15FO441.  Atty Voorhees statement to court - states possible that he hasn't gotten to all his phone messages and notes did expect defendant to be here and states is on probation and asks court to stay issuance of any warrant.  Court notes defendant's address is in Oneida.  State moves for warrant.  Court authorizes warrant.

1:54 p.m. Defendant Austin M. Hallock in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15tr789, 15fo441, 15tr922, 15tr923.  State has made offer.  Defendant has asked Voorhees to negotiate further, no resolution today however thinks resolution is likely short of trial. Bond continued. Adj. 1:56 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 11:30 am.

3:02 p.m.  Atty Steven Michlig; Atty John Voorhees with Austin Hallock.
Voorhees states there is agreement to waive PH.
Hallock agrees freely and voluntarily.
Court finds made knowingly and voluntarily waives PH, finds sufficient basis felony committed, bound over.  PTC set for August 4, 2015 at 1:30 p.m.
